title: Sabarimala gold theft case: SIT likely to challenge bail granted to Tantri Kandararu Rajeevaru
content: Officials say SIT earlier sought legal opinion on overriding certain damning observations made by Kollam Vigilance court while granting bail to Tantri

title: Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic: MSRDC to credit toll refunds to FASTags after 33-hour ordeal
content: The refund, amounting to approximately ₹5.16 crore, will be credited directly to the FASTags of the affected vehicle owners, a senior MSRDC official confirmed

title: Thane tribunal orders ₹28.68 lakh compensation to tailor, domestic help injured in 2018 accident
content: The tailor suffered 80% permanent disability after paralysis of both her lower limbs, but the MACT pegged her functional disability at 50%, noting that contemporary electric sewing machines may be operated using hands and elbows.

title: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee condoles Mukul Roy's death, recalls long political association
content: The West Bengal CM said she was "shocked and saddened" by Mr. Roy's passing and recalled that he had worked tirelessly for the Trinamool Congress since its founding, earning acceptance across all levels of the party

title: Kerala’s LDF govt to announce completion of 5 lakh houses under LIFE Mission on February 24
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan says government has spent around ₹20,831.60 crore on LIFE Mission scheme

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly election: MMK to contest on DMK’s ‘Rising Sun’ symbol
content: The party led by M.H. Jawahirullah held talks with the DMK’s seat-sharing committee on Monday and sought five seats

title: Maharashtra Health Minister promises strict action in Thane egg-donation racket
content: Police recently busted the racket, wherein victims were offered ₹25,000 to ₹30,000 per cycle and repeatedly used as egg donors, resulting in physical exploitation

title: Jharkhand civic polls: 12% voter turnout recorded in 48 ULBs till 9 a.m.
content: As many as 562 candidates, including 235 women, are in the fray for the posts of Mayor and chairperson, while 5,562 candidates, including 2,727 women, are contesting the posts of ward councillors

title: Govt exempts tailing recycling in mines from fresh green clearance
content: Industry experts said earlier, even activities like tailing recycling within approved mine areas required separate EC, leading to delays

title: Tamil Nadu SIR LIVE: Final electoral rolls being published by Election Commission of India
content: The final electoral roll of Puducherry was published on February 14, 2026 after the statutory period for filing of claims and objections. The Union Territory has an electorate of 9,44,211

title: Watch: Guwahati’s new airport terminal now operational
content: The new terminal at Lokapriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport began commercial operations on February 22, marking a major boost to connectivity in the Northeast. Himanta Biswa Sarma welcomed the first passengers as a ceremonial boarding pass was issued. Designed by architect Nuru Karim, the award-winning terminal is inspired by Assam’s kopou phool and features over 140 MT of bamboo, blending regional identity with modern infrastructure.

title: PM Modi condoles demise of ex-Union Minister Mukul Roy
content: Roy was once regarded as West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's most trusted lieutenant and the TMC's principal strategist

title: Shirtless protest at AI Summit: Delhi Police nabs Youth Congress worker in Gwalior, total arrests 5
content: The investigators are also probing the financial trail behind the protest, including who funded printing slogans on the T-shirts

title: Allegations of medical negligence after child dies following injections at hospital in Kerala’s Kattakkada
content: The family alleged that the two-and-a-half-year-old child, who was brought to Mamal multispeciality hospital with breathlessness, was given injections at the hospital, following which the child lost consciousness

title: Kerala Assembly Budget session resumes amid Opposition uproar over Sabarimala gold theft case
content: Soon after Question Hour began, Opposition persisted with its demand that Devaswom Minister should resign. Opposition also reiterated its allegation that Chief Minister’s office was interfering with the SIT probe

title: Two schools in Delhi receive bomb threat; search operations underway
content: According to the police, Army Public School in Dhaula Kuan and Air Force Bal Bharti School on Lodhi Road received bomb threats

title: PhonePe launches AI-powered natural language search built on Microsoft Foundry
content: "This feature enables PhonePe users to initiate and complete in-app tasks via natural language text or voice commands, enhancing convenience and bringing personalisation to the platform’s overall experience," PhonePe

title: VACB records Union Minister Suresh Gopi’s statement in Sabarimala flagmast installation case
content: Suresh Gopi is among 27 persons who donated gold and cash for installation of flagmast. Officials say actors Mohanlal and Renji Panicker, and film producer M. Renjith, were among the donors, and that VACB will record their statements

title: Congress demands arrest of BJP State president Madhav
content: Congress party leader Kolanukonda Shivaji accuses him of inciting attack on the party headquarters in Vijayawada

title: Mukul Roy, former Union Railway Minister, passes away after prolonged illness
content: Mukul Roy breathed his last  at 1.30 a.m. at the private hospital, his son Subhranshu Roy said, adding that he had been in a coma for the last several days

title: JNU protest turns violent; JNUSU, ABVP accuse each other of attacks
content: Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) had called for a "Samta Juloos" towards the East Gate, demanding the resignation of Vice-Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit and revocation of a rustication order

title: Why are apple traders in J&K worried? | Explained
content: Why are apple producers concerned about the trade deals with the U.S. and the EU? Why are countries in the West able to produce a better yield of apples? What about controlled-atmosphere cold storage prices? Why are party leaders urging the Union government to re-evaluate the deal?

title: Indian Embassy issues advisory for its nationals in Mexico after powerful drug lord El Mencho killed
content: Indian citizens were advised by Embassy to avoid areas around law enforcement activity and to be aware of their surroundings and avoid crowds. They were told to seek shelter and minimize unnecessary movements outside shelter and follow local news for updates.

title: Uttarakhand education staff to boycott work over 'assault' of director by BJP MLA supporters
content: The meeting also decided that if the accused are not arrested within two days, all offices in the State, from the nagar panchayat to the state secretariat, will boycott work starting February 25.

title: Bengal unemployment aid scheme | Queuing up for cash
content: Lakhs of people in the 21-40 age group are lining up across West Bengal to register for the Banglar Yuba Saathi scheme announced by the Trinamool Congress government ahead of the Assembly poll. Shrabana Chatterjee and Shiv Sahay Singh look into what this unemployment allowance means for those who do not have jobs and how they are surviving in meagrely paid contractual jobs offered by the State

title: 'Continued delay' in restoration of Statehood to J&K is concerning: Farooq Abdullah
content: Repeated assurances have been made at the highest levels regarding the restoration of statehood at the earliest. However, the absence of a clear timeline has created uncertainty and disappointment among the people, says Farooq Abdullah

title: Ruling powers conspiring to weaken Constitution: Tejashwi Yadav
content: Tejashwi Yadav termed the BJP a reservation-thief, adding that the double-engine government has deprived the exploited, the backward, the most backward, the Dalits, and the tribals of reservations.

title: RCP Singh pitches to come back in JD(U)
content: Senior JD-(U) leader and Union Minister Rajeev Ranjan Singh alias Lalan Singh and Bihar Minister Shravan Kumar have been openly opposing his entry into the party. RCP asserted that his presence in JD-(U) will benefit the party and organisation.

title: Protecting the freedom of speech of MPs
content: That the freedom of speech of MPs is subject to the rules of the Houses seems to have created the wrong impression that the provisions of the rules can override constitutional rights

title: Congress still weighing options as it enters negotiating table for T.N. Assembly polls
content: Meanwhile, a senior member of the VCK, another ally, says if the DMDK is allotted more than six or seven seats, it meant the DMK was preparing for the Congress’s exit

title: Over 300 textile mills shut in Tamil Nadu in last few years, says report
content: Many small-scale mills have shut due to rising input costs, steep hike in power tariff, and high cost of borrowing, says spinning mills association

title: 8 persons admitted to hospitals in Rajahmundry with symptoms of anuria
content: Elderly woman dies on Sunday; victims believed to have consumed adulterated milk; blood samples being collected

title: India condemns Pakistan's airstrikes on Afghan territory
content: New Delhi described the strikes as another attempt by Pakistan to "externalise its internal failures", and reiterated its support for Afghanistan's sovereignty and territorial integrity

title: H.D. Kumaraswamy asks Chief Minister Siddaramaiah to vacate his post to show love and generosity towards Vokkaligas
content: Hitting back at Chief Minister Siddaramaiah over his comments on the Janata Dal (Secular) leadership and Vokkaliga politics, Union Minister for Heavy Industries and Steel H.D. Kumaraswamy on Sunday suggested that the time was ripe for him to shower love on Vokkaligas by vacating his post

title: Now, Siddaramaiah lists out Vokkaligas in Congress capable of providing leadership to community
content: CM says Congress is the only party that could provide opportunities for those from Vokkaliga and Dalit communities to become Chief Ministers in future

title: Looking forward to Israel visit: PM Modi
content: India deeply values the enduring friendship with Israel, built on trust, innovation and a shared commitment to peace and progress, says Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Minister launches project to build three new bypass roads in Tiruvannamalai
content: The roads will help vehicles bypass narrow stretches between Tindivanam and Tiruvannamalai, and reach places like Coimbatore, Salem, Krishnagiri, Dharmapuri, Hosur, Bengaluru, and Vellore

title: Healthy lifestyle key to keeping heart fit, says doctor
content: Nearly 80% of cardiac ailments preventable, says Dr. A. Purnanand at Praja Arogya Vedika seminar in Vijayawada

title: BSP striving to obtain ‘master key of power’ through democratic means, says Mayawati at all-India meet
content: The national meeting held in Lucknow also flags trade concerns, notes challenges to safeguard interests and future of country’s farmers and Bahujans

title: Months before his death, Manipur MLA wrote to PM, sought probe on mob attack
content: The letter was sent on September 13, 2025, when PM Modi made his maiden visit to Manipur after the ethnic violence broke out on May 3, 2023. Arambai Tenggol, a relatively new radical Meitei armed group, gained notoriety after the conflict between the Meitei and Kuki-Zo communities started

title: Delhi CM targets Trinamool over infiltration, crimes against women
content: Rekha Gupta accuses West Bengal government of stalling SIR, failing on women’s safety; Trinamool cites NCRB crime data and development indicators

title: Fresh FIR against RTI activist Snehamayi Krishna
content: Krishna was earlier questioned and later released on Saturday over allegations that he used his Facebook account to circulate fabricated documents, edited photographs and manipulated audio clips targeting former MUDA Commissioner D.B. Natesh

title: Calcutta HC sets up committee to shift urgent matters to other courts, focus on final touches to SIR
content: Chief Justice Sujoy Paul meets Chief Electoral Office, Chief Secretary, Director General of Police, Commissioner of Police, and other senior officials representing the Union of India

title: Sena (UBT) stakes claim to lone Rajya Sabha seat
content: Sanjay Raut says that being the largest constituent of the opposition MVA, the party has the first right to win the alliance’s quota

title: Police arrest two in Bagalkot stone-throwing incident
content: Sriramulu says State government’s minority appeasement policy has made the District Police helpless against dangerous communal elements

title: Stalin gave ₹5,000 only because of pressure from AIADMK, says Palaniswami
content: At a public meeting in Tiruvallur district, the AIADMK general secretary recalls having made 10 electoral assurances, including one of granting a monthly assistance of ₹2,000 to all women heads of families holding ration cards. Soon after his party announced the promises, Mr. Stalin grew anxious and credited the sum into the accounts of Kalaignar Magalir Urimai Thogai beneficiaries

title: Rashtrapati Bhavan to get Rajagopalachari’s statue
content: The Prime Minister said that the country is now shunning symbols of colonial rule and embracing Indian heroes and culture

title: Gunshots fired at student outside BHU hostel
content: Students stage protest against poor security situation on the campus, demand immediate arrest of culprits

title: Dismiss Piyush Goyal from Cabinet, SKM urges President Murmu
content: The farmers’ body claimed that the Minister has “betrayed the nation’s confidence” by entering into a bilateral trade agreement with the United States

title: ED flags eight priority areas, including IBC misuse and cyber fraud
content: Enforcement Directorate conference focuses on foreign assets, trade-based money laundering, illegal online gambling and drug financing

title: Centre sanctions ₹2,432 crore for Amended BharatNet rollout in Andhra Pradesh
content: MoC signed in Amaravati in presence of N. Chandrababu Naidu and Jyotiraditya Scindia to provide broadband connectivity to 13,426 village panchayats, with focus on last mile access and 98% network uptime

title: Indian envoy calls on Bangladesh FM, discusses strengthening multifaceted bilateral relations
content: “In today’s meeting with the Foreign Minister, I reiterated our position that we look forward to engaging with the new government in Bangladesh,” says Indian High Commissioner in Dhaka

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan inaugurates Vattiyurkavu junction development project
content: The ₹506.48 crore project includes major works over a 10.8-km stretch. Govt. spends ₹89 crore  to acquire 2.31 acre land for the rehabilitation of traders. Vattiyurkavu area will turn into a prominent commercial hub in the capital once the project is completed, says Pinarayi Vijayan.

title: BJP sees conspiracy behind MLA’s arrest in bribery case in Karnataka
content: Party leaders say that the complainant Pujar is a Congress office-bearer and he is part of the conspiracy to trap the MLA

title: KSRTC to set up south India’s largest vehicle scrapping unit in Malappuram
content: The Edappal registered vehicle scrapping facility will cater to the districts of Palakkad, Malappuram, Thrissur, Ernakulam, and Idukki

title: Congress rebuts PM, says women MPs were ‘protesting for a cause’
content: Former Indian Youth Congress chief says protests at international events take place the world over, but no head of state ‘cries like this’

title: Man’s electrocution while fishing sparks concerns over power theft
content: 33-year-old man was electrocuted while fishing in a stream at Chittilanchery near Nenmara on Saturday evening

title: Kerala CM flags ulterior motives behind narratives targeting Kerala
content: Speaking at the grand finale, valedictory ceremony and prize distribution of the first edition of the Chief Minister’s Mega Quiz, Pinarayi says students must be capable of recognising and countering such narratives by having a clear understanding of the State’s history and present-day achievements

title: Human touch of Gramin Dak Sevaks irreplaceable, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: Chief Minister lauds rural postal staff as backbone of India’s vast logistics network and calls for greater support to strengthen services in villages

title: AI summit is a ‘turning point’ in use of tech, says PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the world saw the country’s amazing capabilities in AI when India launched three homegrown AI models at the summit

title: ₹100 crore spent on modernising government presses, says Kerala CM
content: Steps to modernise all government presses would be completed within this year. The government’s policy is not to shut down presses but to strengthen them: CM

title: Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church to provide house for Adimali landslip survivor
content: New home for Sandhya who lost her leg in the landslip. Her husband had lost his life in the incident

title: LeBron stumps for C's Brown in MVP conversation
content: After Jaylen Brown fueled the Celtics' win over the Lakers on Sunday, he received an MVP endorsement from the other side of the storied rivalry.

title: Pacers star Haliburton diagnosed with shingles
content: Pacers point guard Tyrese Haliburton was diagnosed with shingles and will be away from the team for a few weeks, coach Rick Carlisle said Sunday.

title: Kara Braxton, 2-time WNBA champion, dies at 43
content: Kara Braxton, a two-time WNBA champion with the Detroit Shock and former SEC Freshman of the Year at Georgia, has died at the age of 43.

title: Games in Mexico called off after cartel boss killed
content: Four high-level soccer matches were postponed Sunday after the Mexican army killed the leader of a powerful drug cartel in a town close to the World Cup host city of Guadalajara.

title: McKay: Not expecting tush push ban proposal
content: NFL competition committee co-chairman Rich McKay said Sunday that he is not anticipating an attempt to ban the tush push this year.

title: Shields keeps title with win vs. rival Crews-Dezurn
content: Claressa Shields defended her undisputed heavyweight title Sunday night in Detroit by defeating longtime rival Franchon Crews-Dezurn by unanimous decision.

title: Italy throws farewell party, passes torch to France
content: The 2026 Winter Olympics ended as the twin flames in co-host cities Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo were extinguished during a closing ceremony inside ancient Verona Arena.

title: Who makes Team USA in men's hockey at the 2030 Olympics?
content: While the 2026 roster returns home with medals, here's who could represent the U.S. in the French Alps Games.

title: Who is the best player in this NFL draft class? Could Vegas trade out of No. 1? We asked around the league
content: We asked NFL execs, scouts and players to weigh in on the Raiders' No. 1 pick and the best prospects in 2026.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: The SEC is the new bids leader, Wisconsin ups its 'lock' odds
content: The Big Ten had an edge over the SEC in projected bid count -- but Saturday's shake-ups have led to a swap.

title: MLB.TV on ESPN: Subscription cost, game coverage, more facts
content: ESPN is the home of MLB.TV! Learn how to sign up for a subscription, watch your favorite games and take full advantage of this exciting product now.

title: Tyler Reddick triumphs in 2OT, gives Jordan another win
content: Tyler Reddick rebounded from a crash to become the first driver in 17 years to sweep the first two races of a NASCAR Cup Series season, winning in double overtime Sunday at Echo Park Speedway.

title: Arsenal answer title pressure with resounding derby win at Tottenham
content: Despite the growing pressure in the title race, Mikel Arteta's team responded with character to claim a 4-1 victory over their local rivals and deliver a message to their critics.

title: Messi struggles in MLS opener; will it impact his World Cup hopes?
content: Lionel Messi had a decent game in the 3-0 defeat to LAFC, but decent isn't what you expect from him, especially during a World Cup year.

title: How does an NFL player decide to retire? 'I'm not done'
content: Eric Weddle, Tony Jefferson and Andrew Whitworth share stories of their journeys in and out of retirement.

title: Who's the best second baseman in MLB? Buster Olney ranks the top 10
content: Does Marte's offense put him on top? Or does Hoerner's elite defense make him No. 1? Here's how our list shakes out.

title: Ranking the top 10 first basemen in MLB: Is Vlad Jr. or Kurtz No. 1?
content: Our top-10 rankings continue with a look at baseball's best first basemen, including the A's budding star.

title: World No. 1 Jeeno Thitikul wins home LPGA Thailand
content: World No. 1 Jeeno Thitikul justified her top billing in emphatic fashion after beating Japan's Chizzy Iwai by one stroke to capture and claim her home LPGA Thailand tournament for the first time.

title: NBA MVP straw poll 2.0: SGA, Jokic lead our update -- but chaos looms
content: With so many MVP contenders in danger of missing the 65-game threshold, this race could take a sharp turn.

title: College football's 100 best quarterbacks of the 2000s
content: Make way for Fernando Mendoza and others on Bill Connelly's updated list of the greatest quarterbacks of the century.

title: Boxing is better when Ryan Garcia is on top of his game
content: The stakes have never been higher for Ryan Garcia, with Shakur Stevenson and Devin Haney waiting in the wings.

title: MVP should book these fights on the Rousey vs. Carano card
content: Brock Lesnar and Anderson Silva back in MMA? Jake Paul could take the May 16 card over the top with names like that.

title: Nine tips to help you win your league
content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

title: Transfer rumors, news: Julian Alvarez to snub Premier League for Barcelona?
content: Julian Alvarez is on the radar for Liverpool and Arsenal this summer, but the Atletico Madrid forward is apparently eyeing a move elsewhere in LaLiga. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: 'He is son of a big politician': How argument over 'dust' snowballed into racial abuse in Delhi
content: Three women from Arunachal Pradesh faced racial slurs and threats in Delhi's Malviya Nagar after a dispute over falling debris. Neighbors allegedly hurled derogatory remarks about their community and profession. Police have registered a case following a viral video of the incident, which began during AC installation work.

title: Trump’s tariff defeat: India and China big winners; US allies pay the price
content: India emerges a key beneficiary as the US Supreme Court struck down President Trump's emergency tariffs. This ruling injects leverage into ongoing trade talks, potentially allowing New Delhi to secure better terms. While offering temporary relief, the shift to a new tariff framework signals a complex period for global exporters and US trade policy. UK has been the biggest loser among the US allies.

title: Two brothers shot dead at wedding reception in Patna
content: Tragedy struck a wedding reception in Shahpur village, Bihar, late Sunday evening. Two brothers, Manjeet Kumar and Manish Kumar, were shot dead by unidentified assailants. Preliminary investigations suggest an old dispute, possibly property-related, led to the fatal incident. Police are actively searching for the accused and have sent the bodies for post-mortem.

title: What is the IDFC First Bank Rs 590 cr fraud case? Explained - check top 10 points
content: IDFC First Bank Managing Director and CEO V. Vaidyanathan sought to limit the fallout, asserting that the lapse was restricted in scope and stemmed from internal collusion rather than any broader structural weakness.

title: ‘He’s sweating now’: Activists hang ex-prince Andrew arrest photo inside Louvre Museum
content: A British activist group, 'Everyone Hates Elon,' staged a daring stunt at the Louvre, hanging a framed photo of ex-Prince Andrew. The image, taken after his arrest on misconduct charges, was captioned 'He's Sweating Now,' referencing his controversial 2019 interview. The group's bold move aims to draw attention to the ongoing scrutiny surrounding Andrew's association with Jeffrey Epstein.

title: America's biggest investor has an 'End question' for Google, Amazon & others
content: Investor Michael Burry is questioning Big Tech's $660 billion AI infrastructure spending spree, warning that companies like Amazon, Google, Meta, and Microsoft are burning through cash, piling on debt, and using aggressive depreciation schedules to mask the earnings impact. Drawing parallels to the early electricity boom—where the technology was real but investors still got wiped out—Burry argues the financial engineering deserves far more scrutiny.

title: Where are gold prices headed this week & what are the key levels? Top things to know
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices suggest an underlying bullish bias, according to Manav Modi, Senior Analyst, Commodity Research at Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd. The commodities’ expert shares the factors that will guide gold prices in the coming days and key levels to watch out for:

title: India qualification scenario: How can Team India reach T20 WC semi-final?
content: India's T20 World Cup 2026 semi-final hopes are in jeopardy following a significant 76-run defeat to South Africa. Chasing 188, India crumbled to 111, with Marco Jansen taking four wickets. This loss severely impacted India's Net Run Rate, leaving them needing crucial wins against the West Indies and Zimbabwe to advance.

title: Anthropic engineer’s doomsday warning: AI agents will take over engineers, designers and …
content: Anthropic engineer Borsi Cherny warns that advanced AI agents, like Claude Code, will soon transform nearly all computer-based jobs, potentially eliminating roles like software engineer by 2026.  He urges workers to adapt and embrace these tools, as similar concerns about AI's impact on entry-level positions are echoed by Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr and Oxford Economics.

title: Rashmika Mandanna builds Rs 8 crore villa; wedding set for Feb 26
content: Pan-Indian star Rashmika Mandanna's serene Kodagu abode, valued at Rs 8 crore, offers a tranquil retreat amidst lush greenery. This modern single-storey mansion boasts a charming courtyard, a spacious veranda with a swing, and elegant interiors featuring wooden fittings and ample natural light.  The actress also reportedly owns properties in other major cities.

title: Tejas aircraft damaged after overshooting runway; IAF grounds fleet
content: An Indian Air Force Tejas fighter jet suffered major airframe damage after overshooting the runway due to suspected brake failure. The pilot ejected safely, and the entire Tejas fleet has been grounded for technical scrutiny. This incident marks the third accident involving the Tejas jets.

title: Supermarkets, banks, cars set ablaze: Mexico cartel goes on revenge spree after El Mencho killed
content: Mexico experienced a coordinated wave of retaliation following the killing of feared cartel boss El Mencho. Gunmen loyal to the CJNG leader blocked highways and torched businesses, disrupting air travel and prompting residents to seek shelter. This show of force, described as revenge, highlights the ongoing challenges of cartel violence in the country.

title: When Steve Jobs told Apple employees during a townhall: Nike sells shoes, and yet ...
content: Steve Jobs, upon his return to Apple in 1997, found inspiration in Nike's marketing to revitalize the brand. He emphasized that marketing should focus on values and what a company stands for, not just product specifications. Jobs believed Apple, like Nike, should connect with people's passions and their desire to change the world.

title: BAFTA 2026 honors Dharmendra in memoriam tribute with Val Kilmer, Robert Duvall and others
content: Indian cinema legend Dharmendra was honored in the BAFTA Awards 2026 Memoriam, a poignant tribute to his illustrious career. He was the sole Indian actor featured alongside Hollywood greats. The article also highlights Manipur's film 'Boong' winning Best Children's and Family Film, marking a significant moment for Indian cinema at the prestigious awards. Read on to know more in detail.

title: ‘We’re looking at matchups’: India coach breaks silence after Axar snub sparks row
content: India's T20 World Cup gamble backfired as Axar Patel's omission for Washington Sundar in the Super 8 clash against South Africa led to a crushing defeat. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate admitted the difficult selection, driven by tactical matchups and the desire for an extra batter, ultimately proved costly. The team hopes Axar understands the strategic intent.

title: Powerful winter storm hits US, blizzard warnings pile up; Air India issues advisory
content: A powerful winter storm has unleashed blizzard conditions across the US Northeast, prompting widespread travel bans and flight cancellations. New York City and New Jersey declared travel emergencies as up to two feet of snow and strong winds reduced visibility. Forecasters were surprised by the storm's rapid intensification, potentially qualifying it as a bomb cyclone.

title: Congress's 'shirtless' protest row: BJP trains guns at grand-old-party; police make 5th arrest
content: Delhi Police arrested Jitendra Yadav in Gwalior, marking the fifth arrest in connection with the Youth Congress protest at the AI Impact Summit. The protest, described by a court as a "blatant assault on public order," involved displaying T-shirts with slogans against the government and a trade deal, leading to a scuffle with security.

title: 'Let them breathe': Yousuf mocks India, brands Amir a 'menace' after defeat
content: India's Super 8 campaign commenced with a significant 76-run defeat against South Africa in Ahmedabad. The loss severely impacted India's net run rate, necessitating wins in their remaining matches against Zimbabwe and the West Indies to keep semi-final hopes alive. This outcome also reignited Mohammad Amir's earlier prediction of India struggling to reach the semi-finals.

title: 'Without Mamata di …': Mani Shankar Aiyar's advise to Rahul Gandhi on INDIA bloc leadership
content: Veteran Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar asserted Mamata Banerjee is crucial for the INDIA bloc's survival, urging Rahul Gandhi to cede leadership to smaller parties. Aiyar, who expressed admiration for Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, also voiced contempt for Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera. The party has since distanced itself from Aiyar's controversial statements.

title: 'VIROSH': Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda announce their wedding
content: Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda have finally made it official — and the internet can’t keep calm. The much-loved duo took to social media to announce their upcoming wedding, sending fans into an emotional frenzy. But that wasn’t the only surprise. In a heartfelt revelation, the couple shared that their big day will be known as “The Wedding of VIROSH” — a name that carries years of love, memories and fandom behind it.

title: 2 Punjab cops shot dead inside police outpost near Pakistan border
content: Two policemen were shot dead inside a police outpost in Gurdaspur, Punjab, near the Pakistan border. Unidentified assailants attacked the outpost, leaving ASI Gurnam Singh and home guard Ashok Kumar with no chance to react. The killings have raised serious questions about security preparedness in the sensitive border region.

title: After US SC verdict, stock market opens in green: Nifty above 25,700, Sensex jumps 600 points
content: Indian stock markets opened higher on Monday, with Nifty50 and BSE Sensex trading in green, boosted by positive global cues. This optimism follows a US Supreme Court ruling against President Trump's tariffs, though new tariff increases were announced. Crude oil prices dipped as nuclear negotiations progressed.

title: Inside Sidney Crosby and Kathy Leutner’s combined $76M net worth
content: The net worth of Sidney Crosby and Kathy Leutner is estimated to be 76 million, with the ongoing NHL season. Penguins' captain has mostly acquired his fortune in salary and endorsements, whilst Leutner has established a separate model career. This is a breakdown of how the NHL star and his spouse are in their financial position in 2026.

title: Taylor Swift’s one-word comment turns Shiffrin’s gold into Swiftie moment
content: Mikaela Shiffrin celebrated her 2026 Winter Olympics slalom gold with Taylor Swift lyrics on Instagram, then got a 1-word comment from the pop star: “HISTORIC ������.” Inside how Shiffrin uses “Ruin the Friendship” to fuel races, why Swift’s reply mattered, and how the singer keeps stealing scenes at the Winter Games with Breezy Johnson too.

title: IDFC First Bank stock crashes 20% after Rs 590 cr fraud in Haryana govt accounts
content: IDFC First Bank shares plunged 20% after the bank revealed a Rs 590 crore fraud at its Chandigarh branch involving unauthorized transactions from Haryana government accounts. Four employees have been suspended as an internal investigation and police complaint are underway. The bank is taking steps to recover funds and conduct a forensic audit, assuring other customers remain unaffected.

title: Connor McDavid and wife Lauren Kyle McDavid combined net worth 2026
content: The success of the professional career of Connor McDavid and his wife, Lauren Kyle McDavid, is reflected in the financial empire they have created. Whether it is McDavid and his lucrative Edmonton Oilers contract and endorsement book or the growing design and hospitality businesses of Lauren, the two have a combined net worth in 2026 that can be seen as a wise investment, brand strength and long-term excellence on and off the ice.

title: ‘So much tariff coming in’: Trump floats $2,000 payments without Congress approval
content: President Trump insists on a $2,000 payment to Americans, funded by tariffs, potentially bypassing Congress. This claim faces significant hurdles after the Supreme Court limited his tariff authority, potentially requiring billions in refunds. Trump has since adjusted his tariff strategy, but the program's affordability remains uncertain.

title: Who was 'El Mencho' and what's next for Mexico's fastest-growing cartel?
content: Mexico’s most-wanted drug lord Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, known as El Mencho, was killed during a government operation in Jalisco, triggering nationwide cartel violence. Founder of the powerful Jalisco New Generation Cartel, he built one of Mexico’s fastest-growing and most aggressive criminal organisations. His death is a major blow to the group but raises fears of fragmentation, succession struggles and escalating “narcoterrorism” as rivals and factions vie for control.

title: 'Be aware': Indian embassy issues advisory for nationals in Mexico after powerful drug lord killed
content: The Indian Embassy in Mexico has issued an urgent advisory for its citizens to remain indoors due to widespread violence following a major security operation. The operation resulted in the death of a top Jalisco New Generation Cartel leader, sparking retaliatory actions across several states and paralyzing transport networks.

title: On-field drama! Miller and Sundar locked in heated exchange — watch
content: India's T20 World Cup title defence is in jeopardy after a significant 76-run defeat to South Africa. Despite a strong start, India faltered as David Miller's 63 powered South Africa to 187. A mid-innings spat between Miller and Washington Sundar briefly flared. India's chase collapsed after Ishan Kishan's early dismissal, leaving them bowled out for 111.

title: Bengaluru: Ambulance rushing to attend critically ill patient stopped midway, driver abused
content: An ambulance responding to a critical patient faced a 15-minute delay near Alliance University after grazing a car. The car driver, allegedly with students, blocked the emergency vehicle, leading to verbal abuse of the driver. Police intervened, registering a case and detaining two individuals. Motorists are legally obligated to yield to emergency vehicles.

title: 18 dead, several injured in Nepal after passenger bus plunges into river in Dhading
content: A passenger bus veered off a road and plunged into the Trishuli River in Dhading, Nepal, early Monday, resulting in at least 18 fatalities and 25 injuries. The bus, en route from Pokhara to Kathmandu, was carrying over 35 passengers when the accident occurred. Rescue operations are underway, though challenging due to the nighttime incident.

title: 'Ambushed': ABVP claims late-night attack by Left groups on JNU campus
content: Jawaharlal Nehru University witnessed a violent clash early February 23, with ABVP alleging Left-wing groups attacked students.  One student was reportedly blinded and severely injured.  ABVP claims masked individuals disrupted study rooms and assaulted students, with one student allegedly mob lynched.  The group condemned the violence and demanded immediate police action.

title: Mexico's most wanted drug lord El Mencho killed in major military op; had $15m bounty
content: Mexico's most wanted drug lord, El Mencho, was killed in a military operation in Jalisco, sparking widespread retaliatory violence. The operation, a significant blow to organized crime, led to road blockages, arson, and clashes across multiple states, prompting travel advisories from the US and Canada.

title: Sexual harassment row in Bangladesh cricket: BCB bans ex-women’s selector
content: The Bangladesh Cricket Board has banned former women’s selector Monjurul Islam from all cricket-related roles after an inquiry into sexual misconduct allegations by ex-captain Jahanara Alam. The panel found initial proof in two allegations, calling his behaviour harassment. The BCB said it may take further action. It also announced the Women’s Bangladesh Premier League dates and gave chief selector Gazi Ashraf Hossain a one-month extension.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for this week - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Max Financial, and Delhivery are stocks recommended for buying by Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd for the trading week starting February 23, 2026. Below is a detailed analysis:

title: 3 women from Arunachal Pradesh allege racial abuse by neighbours in south Delhi
content: Three women from Arunachal Pradesh reported racial abuse and threats from a couple in Delhi's Malviya Nagar. An argument over dirt allegedly falling from their rented accommodation escalated into derogatory remarks and intimidation. Police have registered a case under various sections of the BNS, and the couple has been asked to join the investigation.

title: SCOTUS ruling opens door to better deal? Govt pauses US trade team visit amid Tariff turbulence
content: India has rescheduled its trade deal negotiations with the US following the Supreme Court's invalidation of Trump's tariffs. This move allows for an evaluation of the ruling's implications, as other nations like South Korea have seen their tariff agreements nullified.

title: Jason Kelce reveals hidden struggle fame created for his family
content: After retiring from the NFL, Jason Kelce found that fame only intensified, making everyday life more complicated for his family. Increased public attention, fueled by media work and his brother Travis Kelce’s relationship with Taylor Swift, turned routine outings into public moments. Despite the spotlight, Kelce and his wife Kylie remained committed to giving their four daughters as normal a childhood as possible.

title: What happened with Androgenic? Unexpected on-camera moment goes viral
content: A viral video showing Androgenic’s hat being pulled off sparked major debate online. Viewers questioned his image after seeing what appeared to be a receding hairline. The term “fraudmaxxer” trended on X, and some online rankings reportedly dropped him. While the video’s authenticity remains unverified, the incident has fueled discussion about honesty in the self-improvement world.

title: India plans to buy Israel’s advanced drones, missiles, laser defence systems
content: India is bolstering its defence capabilities by seeking advanced Israeli drones, missiles, and laser systems to create an "impregnable" shield against future Pakistani attacks. Discussions are expected during PM Modi's visit, potentially leading to an MoU on security cooperation and technology transfer. This move aims to integrate cutting-edge Israeli tech with India's indigenous defence plans.

title: Former TMC leader and 32nd railway minister, Mukul Roy, dies of cardiac arrest
content: Veteran politician Mukul Roy, a former railway minister and founding TMC member, passed away from a cardiac arrest at 1:30 am. Roy, who represented Krishnanagar Uttar and served twice in the Rajya Sabha, had a notable political journey, including stints with the BJP before rejoining the TMC. His son confirmed the news.

title: From Trinamool Founding Member To BJP MLA: All About Mukul Roy
content: A founding member of the All India Trinamool Congress, Mukul Roy was among the key organisers of the party in its early years. He was considered a close associate of West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee.

title: Mexico Cartel Leader Killed LIVE: Indian Embassy Issues Advisory For Citizens In Mexico After Killing Of Drug Lord 'El Mencho'
content: Mexico Cartel Leader Killed LIVE Updates: The Mexican military killed Nemesio Ruben Oseguera Cervantes, known as "El Mencho," the powerful leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG)

title: What To Know About The Killing Of A Powerful Cartel Leader In Mexico
content: The Mexican army killed the country's most powerful cartel leader and one of the United States' most wanted fugitives, notching a major victory while cartel members responded with a wave violence across the country.

title: Netherland's Youngest And First Openly Gay Prime Minister To Take Oath
content: The new Dutch government will be sworn in, with 38-year-old centrist Rob Jetten set to be the country's youngest-ever prime minister and the first openly gay one.

title: 9-Month Pregnant Woman Allegedly Assaulted By Husband, In-Laws In Bengaluru
content: A nine-month pregnant woman has filed a complaint against her husband and in-laws in Bengaluru, alleging assault.

title: US, Canada Issue Travel Warnings For Mexico After Drug Kingpin Killing
content: The US State Department on Sunday urged American citizens in parts of Mexico to shelter in place amid violence, road blocks and flight cancellations after Mexican soldiers killed a top cartel boss.

title: "Let My Mother-In-Law Die": Note Found In Karnataka Temple's Donation Box
content: People usually go to temples asking for long life, good health, or peace for their family. But in a twist no one expected, a person in Karnataka's Belagavi district seemed to pray for the exact opposite

title: US Suspends Global Entry As Partial Government Shutdown Drags On
content: The Department of Homeland Security said Sunday that the Global Entry program would be shut down as long as the partial government shutdown remains in effect.

title: On CCTV, Minors Stab Class 10 Student 27 Times In 30 Seconds At Snooker Club
content: A class 10 student was stabbed 27 times in 30 seconds inside a snooker club in Madhya Pradesh's capital, Bhopal. In an even more disturbing and daring twist, the accused themselves allegedly circulated the CCTV footage on social media.

title: 18 People Killed As Bus Falls Into River In Nepal
content: At least 18 people were killed when a passenger bus fell into the Trishuli river near Gajuri in the Dhading district of Nepal early morning on Monday.

title: Putin Says Developing Russia's Nuclear Forces 'Absolute Priority'
content: President Vladimir Putin said that developing Russia's nuclear forces was now an "absolute priority" following the expiry of its last remaining nuclear treaty with the US.

title: From Knesset Speech To Bilateral Pacts: What's On PM Modi's Israel Agenda
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to make a high-profile visit to Israel this week, marking his second trip to the country after the historic 2017 visit and his first during his third term in office.

title: 'Thanks, But No Thanks': To Trump's Hospital Ship Plan, Greenland's Response
content: U.S. President Donald Trump said he would deploy a hospital ship to Greenland, alleging that many people there are sick and not receiving care, even though both of the U.S. Navy's hospital ships are currently docked at a shipyard in Alabama.

title: "Many Want Stalin To Lead": Udhayanidhi Amid Opposition Leadership Row
content: In yet another sign of a leadership tussle within the INDIA bloc, the Congress's Tamil Nadu ally DMK has said its chief MK Stalin should lead the fight against the BJP.

title: NASA To Return Moon Rocket To Hangar For More Repairs Before Astronauts Strap In
content: Grounded until at least April, NASA's giant moon rocket is headed back to the hangar this week for more repairs before astronauts climb aboard.

title: How Mexico Army Killed 'El Mencho', Drug Lord Who Evaded Arrest For Years
content: The Mexican government has said that its security forces have killed the country's most wanted cartel boss, setting off a wave of violent reprisals across several states as cartel operatives sought to exact revenge in a show of force.

title: JNU Protest Turns Violent, Student Groups Accuse Each Other Of Attacks
content: Tensions flared on the campus of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) after student groups aligned with the Left and Right accused each other of unleashing violence during a protest march in early hours of Monday.

title: Iran-US Talks Expected Thursday Despite Fears Of Strikes
content: Iranian officials held out hope for progress towards a deal to forestall fresh conflict when talks with US negotiators resume on Thursday, despite a huge build-up of American military might in the Middle East.

title: Mumbai-Pune Expressway Jam: 1 Lakh Vehicles To Get Rs 5.16 Crore Toll Refund
content: More than one lakh motorists who were caught up in a massive traffic gridlock on Mumbai-Pune Expressway earlier this month after a gas tanker mishap will get toll refund cumulatively valued at Rs 5.16 crore.

title: Gold, Silver Prices On February 23: Silver Rises By Rs 23,820, Gold Crosses Rs 1,59,000 On MCX
content: Gold and silver prices witnessed a notable uptick on Monday on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX). Gold futures for April were trading at Rs 1,59,886 per 10 grams, a rise of Rs 3,010, or 1.92 per cent, as of 09:10 am.

title: How Duke, Arizona, Michigan and Houston should be ranked after Saturday
content: the top four teams in the latest AP poll headlined a loaded Saturday slate . it was the first time the nos. 1 and 2 teams lost on the same day since febr. 8, 2025 . the blue Devils have just two losses all season: by one to Texas Tech in a game they led by 17 .

title: Way-too-early preview for the 2030 Olympics
content: the 2030 Olympics will be spread across the country on sunday . the ice seemed tilted very much in the american's favor for the first time . it's clear Team USA is building a potential dynasty . if you paid attention in the lead-up and during the Games, it is clear team USA could have some growing pain .

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: The Games as told by photos from each day
content: the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics have come to a close, bringing thrilling action and memorable moments in spades . we compiled collages that take a look at the story of each of the Games' days overall, as well as one specific snapshot of particular significance .

title: 🎖️ Shots of gold: USA hockey's win, in pictures
content: team USA defeated canada 2-1 in overtime in the 2026 Olympic men's hockey final . the americans needed less than two minutes in 3-on-3 overtime to win the game . a rematch of last year's 4 Nations face-off title game was canceled . it's the first time team USA has won a gold medal since 1980 .

title: Lakers unveil statue of Riley wearing Armani suit
content: the statue features the famously stylish coach in his preferred attire: a Giorgio Armani suit . the statue depicts Riley holding up his right feisty . he said he would still be wearing suits if he were coaching today .

title: Ranking deepest, thinnest offseason positions: Good year to need ...
content: this year's quarterback class ended up being a good one -- not just through free agency, but also through the draft . the combine fast approaching, we'll hear about which draft prospects are rising and which free agents will actually become available . it's an obviously poor year to need a quarterback .

title: Fixing the NBA's tanking problem: Turn losses into wins
content: the Indiana Pacers are in the nation's capital to face the Washington Wizards . it's a game that should be compelling . Ivica Zubac , Indiana's recently acquired starting center, has yet to play for the club . he remains out with an ankle injury .
